results.title: Formation of the N-nitroso derivatives of six beta-adrenergic-blocking agents and their genotoxic effects in rat and human hepatocytes.
results.text_hl: Modest but statistically significant differences between the @<m>DISEASE_DNA_Virus_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004266 @@@DNA@@@-damaging potencies for the two species were observed with NO-@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and NO-@CHEMICAL_Oxprenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010096 @@@oxprenolol@@@, which were both more active against @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ hepatocytes, and with NO-@CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, which was more active against @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ hepatocytes.

citations.NLM: Robbiano L, Martelli A, Allavena A, Mazzei M, Gazzaniga GM, Brambilla G. Formation of the N-nitroso derivatives of six beta-adrenergic-blocking agents and their genotoxic effects in rat and human hepatocytes. Cancer Res. 1991 May 1;51(9):2273-9. PMID: 1673086
